metadata.title: CVE-2016-8859 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in the TRE library and musl libc allow attackersto cause memory corruption via a large number of (1) states or (2) tags,which triggers an out-of-bounds write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtre5 - 0.8.0-4+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
tre-agrep - 0.8.0-4+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tre package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.0-4+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
musl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
